# AgentWorks Platform Development - MVP Definition

**Version:** 1.0  
**Date:** 2025-12-02  
**Owner:** EngageSuite Bot  
**Generated by:** MVP Agent (OpenAI GPT-4)  
**Based on:** PRD v1.0  

---

## 1. MVP Goal

### MVP Objective
**Prove the agent-native development workflow concept** by delivering a functional single-workspace platform that demonstrates Lanes 0-1 (Blueprint → PRD) with core agents, multi-provider routing, and transparent usage tracking.

### Success Criteria
- **User Acquisition:** 20+ alpha testers completing full Lane 0-1 workflow
- **User Engagement:** Average 2+ blueprint → PRD cycles per user
- **Value Delivery:** Users reaching first PRD completion within 1 hour of signup
- **Validation:** Prove 5x markup model viability with 80%+ gross margins

### Timeline Target
**MVP Timeline:** 6-8 weeks development time  
**Launch Target:** Alpha release by end of Q1 2025

---

## 2. MVP Scope

### 2.1 Core Value Proposition
**Structured AI-driven product development with transparent cost control**

**Primary User Need:** Technical founders need to leverage AI agents for product development while maintaining control and visibility into costs  
**Core Solution:** Agent-native Kanban platform with structured Lane 0-1 workflow (Blueprint → PRD → MVP definition)  
**Success Metric:** Time from signup to completed PRD document with full cost visibility

### 2.2 Target User for MVP
**Technical Founders building startups with limited engineering resources**

**Primary MVP User:** Solo technical founders or small teams (2-5 people) building SaaS products
- **Why This User First:** Highest willingness to adopt new tools, most cost-conscious, need for speed-to-market
- **MVP User Journey:** Signup → Create Blueprint via CEO CoPilot → Generate PRD → Review costs → Export/use documents
- **Success Definition:** Complete structured product planning in 50% less time with full cost transparency

---

## 3. MVP Features

### 3.1 MUST HAVE (Core MVP)

#### Feature 1: Single Workspace with Basic User Management
- **Description:** Core single-tenant workspace with user authentication, profile management, and basic project organization
- **User Story:** As a technical founder, I want to create an account and manage my projects so that I can organize my development workflow
- **MVP Scope:** Single workspace per user, basic auth (email/password), simple project creation
- **Success Metric:** User signup to first project creation time < 5 minutes
- **Estimated Effort:** 5 days

#### Feature 2: Core Kanban Board (Lane 0-1 Focus)
- **Description:** Simple Kanban board with Lane 0 (Blueprint) and Lane 1 (PRD) functionality, drag-and-drop card management
- **User Story:** As a technical founder, I want to move cards through Blueprint and PRD lanes so that I can track my product planning progress
- **MVP Scope:** 2-lane board (Blueprint/PRD), basic card types, simple drag-and-drop
- **Success Metric:** Lane 0-1 completion rate > 80% for active users
- **Estimated Effort:** 6 days

#### Feature 3: CEO CoPilot and PRD Agents
- **Description:** Two core agents: CEO CoPilot for interactive Q&A and PRD Agent for document generation
- **User Story:** As a technical founder, I want to interact with an AI agent to define my product concept and automatically generate a PRD
- **MVP Scope:** CEO CoPilot Q&A interface, PRD Agent with basic templates
- **Success Metric:** PRD generation success rate > 90%
- **Estimated Effort:** 8 days

#### Feature 4: Basic Multi-Provider Routing
- **Description:** Support for 2 LLM providers (OpenAI + Anthropic) with simple routing and cost calculation
- **User Story:** As a technical founder, I want my agent costs routed across different providers so that I have redundancy and cost optimization
- **MVP Scope:** OpenAI and Anthropic APIs, basic routing logic, simple cost tracking
- **Success Metric:** < 1% provider failure rate with automatic fallback
- **Estimated Effort:** 7 days

#### Feature 5: Terminal Logging and Viewing
- **Description:** Simple terminal interface showing agent run logs with basic replay functionality
- **User Story:** As a technical founder, I want to see what my agents are doing in real-time so that I can understand the process and debug issues
- **MVP Scope:** Live log streaming, basic history, simple replay
- **Success Metric:** 100% agent run visibility, logs retained for 30 days
- **Estimated Effort:** 5 days

#### Feature 6: Basic Usage Tracking
- **Description:** Real-time usage monitoring and cost calculation without full billing integration
- **User Story:** As a technical founder, I want to see my AI usage costs in real-time so that I can control my spending
- **MVP Scope:** Token counting, cost display, usage dashboards, no payment processing
- **Success Metric:** < 5% variance in cost calculations vs actual provider costs
- **Estimated Effort:** 4 days

### 3.2 SHOULD HAVE (MVP Enhancement)

#### Feature A: User Onboarding Flow
- **Description:** Guided tutorial and progressive disclosure for first-time users
- **Why Important:** Reduces time-to-value and improves user activation
- **MVP Inclusion:** Include if time permits after core features
- **Post-MVP Priority:** High for v1.1

#### Feature B: Export/Import Functionality
- **Description:** Export PRDs to common formats (PDF, Word, Markdown) and import existing documents
- **Why Important:** Improves integration with existing workflows
- **MVP Inclusion:** Include if time permits
- **Post-MVP Priority:** High for v1.1

### 3.3 COULD HAVE (Future Versions)

#### Feature X: Multi-Tenant Workspaces
- **Description:** Support for multiple workspaces with team collaboration
- **Why Postponed:** Complex billing and user management requirements
- **Future Priority:** v1.2 (post-MVP + 8 weeks)

#### Feature Y: Full 11-Lane Pipeline
- **Description:** Complete Lane 0-10 development pipeline with all agents
- **Why Postponed:** Focus on proving Lane 0-1 concept first
- **Future Priority:** v2.0 (post-MVP + 12 weeks)

#### Feature Z: Advanced Analytics
- **Description:** Comprehensive usage analytics, performance metrics, and business intelligence
- **Why Postponed:** Not essential for proving core concept
- **Future Priority:** v1.2 (post-MVP + 8 weeks)

### 3.4 WON'T HAVE (Explicitly Excluded)

#### Excluded Feature 1: Full Billing Integration
- **Description:** Automated payment processing, invoicing, and subscription management
- **Why Excluded:** Focus on proving concept before monetization complexity
- **Revisit Timeline:** v1.1 (post-MVP + 4 weeks)

#### Excluded Feature 2: Mobile Native Apps
- **Description:** iOS and Android native applications
- **Why Excluded:** Web-first approach with responsive design sufficient for MVP
- **Revisit Timeline:** v2.0 if market demand exists

#### Excluded Feature 3: Advanced Agent Customization
- **Description:** User-configurable agents, custom prompts, and agent marketplace
- **Why Excluded:** Too complex for MVP, focus on proven agent configurations
- **Revisit Timeline:** v2.0+ based on user feedback

## 7. MVP Development Plan

### 7.1 Development Phases

#### Phase 1: Foundation (Weeks 1-2)
- **Infrastructure Setup**
  - Next.js app with TypeScript setup
  - GCP Cloud Run deployment pipeline
  - PostgreSQL database with basic schema
- **Core Authentication** (Feature 1)
  - User signup/login with email/password
  - Session management
  - Basic user profile

#### Phase 2: Core Kanban & Agents (Weeks 3-4)
- **Kanban Board** (Feature 2)
  - Lane 0-1 board layout
  - Basic card management
  - Drag-and-drop functionality
- **Agent Foundation** (Feature 3)
  - CEO CoPilot Q&A interface
  - PRD Agent with basic templates
  - Agent state management

#### Phase 3: Multi-Provider & Tracking (Weeks 5-6)
- **Provider Integration** (Feature 4)
  - OpenAI and Anthropic API integration
  - Basic routing and fallback logic
  - Cost calculation framework
- **Logging System** (Feature 5)
  - Live agent run streaming
  - Basic log storage and replay
  - Terminal interface

#### Phase 4: Usage Tracking & Polish (Weeks 7-8)
- **Usage Dashboard** (Feature 6)
  - Real-time usage monitoring
  - Cost tracking and display
  - Basic analytics
- **Quality Assurance**
  - End-to-end testing of Lane 0-1 flow
  - Performance optimization
  - Security review and deployment preparation

### 7.2 Acceptance Criteria for MVP

**Functional Requirements:**
- [ ] User can sign up, log in, and manage basic profile
- [ ] User can create Blueprint cards and move them to PRD lane
- [ ] CEO CoPilot Q&A interaction works end-to-end
- [ ] PRD Agent can generate complete PRD documents
- [ ] Multi-provider routing works with OpenAI and Anthropic
- [ ] Agent runs are visible in real-time terminal with replay
- [ ] Usage tracking shows accurate costs with < 5% variance

**Quality Requirements:**
- [ ] Lane 0-1 workflow completion rate > 80% success
- [ ] Agent response time < 30 seconds for typical requests
- [ ] System handles 10+ concurrent users without degradation
- [ ] No data loss during normal operations
- [ ] Mobile responsiveness for core Kanban and agent interfaces

**Business Requirements:**  
- [ ] Cost calculation demonstrates 5x markup model viability
- [ ] User analytics track key activation and engagement metrics
- [ ] Basic error reporting and logging infrastructure
- [ ] Alpha testing group can complete full workflow successfully

## 9. Risk Assessment & Mitigation

### 9.1 MVP-Specific Risks

**Development Risks:**
- **Risk:** Feature scope creep during development
- **Mitigation:** Strict feature freeze and change control
- **Monitoring:** Weekly scope review meetings

**Market Risks:**
- **Risk:** MVP doesn't resonate with target users
- **Mitigation:** Early user testing and feedback collection
- **Monitoring:** User engagement metrics and feedback

**Technical Risks:**
- **Risk:** Performance issues with simplified architecture
- **Mitigation:** Performance testing and optimization plan
- **Monitoring:** Response time and user experience metrics

### 9.2 Success Factors for MVP

**Critical Success Factors:**
1. **Focus:** Resist feature additions that don't serve core value
2. **Speed:** Launch quickly to start learning from real users  
3. **Quality:** Ensure core functionality works reliably
4. **Feedback:** Collect and act on user feedback rapidly
5. **Iteration:** Be ready to pivot based on learnings

---

## 10. Launch Plan

### 10.1 MVP Launch Strategy

**Soft Launch Phase (Week 1):**
- Limited user invites (friends, family, beta testers)
- Monitor core metrics and collect feedback
- Fix critical issues and polish rough edges

**Public Launch Phase (Week 2-4):**
- Broader user acquisition campaign
- Press and marketing activities
- Scale infrastructure as needed

### 10.2 Success Validation

**Week 1 Targets:** *[Immediate post-launch metrics]*
**Week 4 Targets:** *[Month 1 success criteria]*
**Week 12 Targets:** *[Quarter 1 validation metrics]*

### Appendix B: User Feedback Collection Plan

**Feedback Channels:**
- In-app feedback widget
- User interview schedule  
- Analytics and behavior tracking
- Support ticket analysis

**Key Questions for MVP Users:**
- Did you accomplish what you came here to do?
- How easy was it to get started?
- What would you change about the experience?
- How likely are you to recommend this to others?
